item.ENTRY: There MUST be a header line
OUTPUT FILE: Input file name + _RESULTS_ + DATE + TIME
Contains input file + requisition no + anticipated
delivery date + delivery discrepancy days + errors
NOTE: All record counts or numbers exclude the header line
RUN OPTIONS: Step 1 = Validate only (test EXCEL file for errors)
Automatically Create Purchasing Requisitions Using An EXCEL File

TLINE.TDLINE: &PURPOSE&
This program will create purchasing requisitions from an EXCEL file. It
uses a BAPI to simulate transactions ME51 or ME51N. The user will be
able to use an EXCEL file directly on their computer.
ABAP Program: ZMMI_CREATE_PURCHASING_REQN
Transaction Code: ZMM_CREATE_PREQ
&INTEGRATION&
&PREREQUISITES&
The first row of the EXCEL file MUST be a header line. It will be
bypassed in the processing. The column widths are allowed to be larger
than the data size to allow better readability. Each row has the
following fields and they must be in this order: order date,
requisitioner, plant, storage location, quantity, unit of measure,
material number, material description, rounding value, lead time,
requested delivery date, purchasing group, material group, tracking
number, price, currency, price unit, account assignment category, g/l
account, WBS element, cost center, order, network, activity, unloading
point, goods recipient, desired vendor, fixed vendor, purchasing
organization, info record number, vendor material, text 1, text 2, text
3, text 4 & text 5. Do not put columns before/after or in the
middle of the data. Do not hide columns. Do not leave data in a column
after the last valid row.
Note: Spectra Energy East & West clients both use the same program
and EXCEL file/template. The program looks for a TVARVC entry called
ZMM_EAST_WEST_IDENTIFIER to contain the value EAST or WEST.
&FEATURES&
The EXCEL file can be a maximum of 20,000 rows. You do not have to exit
the file before running this program, but you must save it. There is a
maximum of 999 items per purchase requisition. A new purchase
requisition is created whenever the requisitioner or plant changes. If
the requisitioner is blank, SAP will insert the SAP logon ID. All data
fields will be validated, even if they are not required to create the
purchasing requisition. Leading zeros and any data alignment will be
done by the program. EXCEL will normally drop leading zeros.
&SELECTION&
(a) The EXCEL input file is a mandatory input. You can enter it
directly or use the symbol to the right of the field to browse/select
the file name. (b) The user has 3 RUN OPTIONS: Validate only, Validate
& load, Validate & load allowing errors (not recommended).
Users should always choose the 'Validate only' option to test/retest
the file for errors. Only after all errors are corrected in the EXCEL
file should userschoose the 'Validate & load' option. The
validation process compares all the input data to the SAP check tables
and reports any errors on your screen. For example, the
material/plant/storage location is validated against the SAP table MARD
to ensure accuracy. This validation occurs in all 3 options. If there
are any errors, the user needs to correct the EXCEL data before
attempting to load. The load process creates the purchase requisition.
The 'Validate & load' option will not attempt to load if there
are any validation errors. The 'Validation & load allowing
errors' should only be used in extreme circumstances when the user
wishes to over-ride the errors. If the 'Validate & load allowing
errors' option is run, users may later find it difficult to know what
line items load and what line items failed. (c) The user must select
which date format is used the the EXCEL file. If the EXCEL date format
is different than the one chosen on the selection screen, an error
message (in red) will appear and all further processing will stop.
&STANDARD_VARIANTS&
&OUTPUT&
There are 3 different types of output that may occur. First, an SAP
results report/screen will appear. Any validation errors that the
program discovers are reported directly back to the user. These errors
are listed for each row in the EXCEL file. If a hard error occurs (when
trying to covert an alphabetic EXCEL cell value to a numeric value), the
program shows the first error and stops. There is also a summary area
of the number of EXCEL rows, number of validation errors, number of BAPI
errors and the number of new purchase requisitions. This summary is at
the end of the report. Secondly, new purchase requisitions are created
in SAP (from the load process) . Lastly, an EXCEL file is created with
the detailed results of the load process. It will contain the original
input EXCEL file plus the following fields: new requisition number,
calculated delivery date, delivery discrepancy in days, SAP error
message. If an SAP error occurs when the BAPI is creating the
purchasing requisition, only 1 error message is returned and it is
attached to all items of the requisition. The EXCEL file name will be
the original file name + _RESULTS_ + date + time.
IMPORTANT: "RESULTS" files should always be monitored for errors. If
the "RESULTS" file contains errors, users need to remove all data
associated with successfully created purchase requisitions, then fix
incorrect data before loading again (or create a different load file).
Failure to remove successfully loaded data will result in duplicate
purchase requisitions if rerun.
&ACTIVITIES&
The order date will be set to the current date if there is no data in
the EXCEL file. Likewise the price unit will default to 1. The storage
location will default to A001 for the East & 0001 for the West.
If there is a material and the requested delivery date is blank, it
will use the current date plus the MRP 2 planned delivery days. If the
currency is blank, the program will use the plant to find the currency.
If the material number is available, the following fields will default
in: unit of measure, material group, material description, purchasing
group, price, g/l account.
&EXAMPLE&
The mandatory fields required to create a purchasing requisition vary,
depending primarily on the account assignment category and whether a
material number is entered. In general, the mandatory fields when a
material number is known are: plant, storage location, material number
and quantity. In general, the mandatory fields when a material is
unknown are: plant, storage location, unit of measure, material
description, quantity, requested delivery date, account assignment
category* and applicable account information. *The non-blank values of
P, F, G & X for the account assignment category will determine
additional fields.
